column4: i got this message when i log into my console! "Your CPU appears to be lacking expected security protections. Please check your BIOS settings, or for more information, run:  /usr/bin/check-bios-nx --verbose" and "System information disabled due to load higher than 1" what's this?

i got this message when i log into my console! "Your CPU appears to be lacking expected security protections. Please check your BIOS settings, or for more information, run:  /usr/bin/check-bios-nx --verbose" and "System information disabled due to load higher than 1" what's this?
Looks like something unexpected is happening with your CPU.  Can you run and pastebin the output of the suggested command?
yes, 1 min pls
here http://paste.ubuntu.com/545946/
i'm running ubuntu on vbox, my primary OS is win7

Right.  Looks like there's a CPU feature that Ubuntu is expecting but is disabled in your BIOS.  Ideally, you want to enable it in your vbox BIOS.  On the other hand, you could install the linux-virtual package and remove the linux-generic package and see if it helps.
if i keep this way, it will give me some problem?
I don't know myself, but Ubuntu doesn't generally complain unless it might.  Looking at the wiki page referenced, it could be a security hole.
ok, thanks, i'll try fix it :)
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1517551 i did not understood, what he 'turned on'? lol
Sorry, one moment, I'll have a look.
ok, noproblem
You need to go into the bios for the host and check that any virtualisation options are enabled, and into the virtual bios for the guest and check that NX is enabled.
you mean the bios of the real cpu, not a bios on the virtualbox?
That for the host, and the NX in the virtualbox bios.
ok, understood, i'll try thanks
What do you mean?  To run .exe files, you'll most often want Wine, or its frontend PlayOnLinux.
For future reference, you can do !br | nick (or another language code) and the bot'll give a nice response for them.
sorry
It's not a problem, it was meant as a little bit of info you might find useful!
